user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of check_apply_param__all_cpus:
```c
static void
check_apply_param__all_cpus (void)
{
  if (! tool_params.all_cpus)
    return;

  num_threads = get_process_cpu_core_count ();
  printf ("Requested use of all available CPU cores for MHD threads.\n");
  if (get_cpu_core_count () == num_threads)
    print_all_cores_used ();
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function check_apply_param__all_cpus:
enum MHD_AuthType type
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No pointer declarations, pointer parameters, or pointer expressions are present in the provided code fragment. The function check_apply_param__all_cpus has no parameters and contains only scalar/enum/field accesses and calls to other functions; there are no pointer types to assess for const qualification. The additional symbol (enum MHD_AuthType type) is an enum, not a pointer. Any pointer usage that might exist inside the called functions (get_process_cpu_core_count, get_cpu_core_count, print_all_cores_used) or in other parts of the program is not present in the supplied code, so it cannot be evaluated here for Rule 8.13. Therefore there are no code fragments in the provided snippet that warrant investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
